message_1: Given the proof of modus ponens (P, P → Q) ⊢ Q, prove that (Q ∨ R) ∧ ¬Q ⊢ R using natural deduction.
message_2:
To prove (Q ∨ R) ∧ ¬Q ⊢ R using natural deduction, we will use the rules of inference, such as conjunction elimination, disjunction elimination, and negation elimination. Here's the step-by-step proof:

1. (Q ∨ R) ∧ ¬Q (Premise)
2. Q ∨ R (1, ∧-Elimination)
3. ¬Q (1, ∧-Elimination)
4. R (2, 3, Disjunction Elimination)
   4.1 Q (Assumption)
   4.2 ⊥ (3, 4.1, ¬-Elimination)
   4.3 R (4.2, ⊥-Elimination)
5. R (2, 3, Disjunction Elimination)
   5.1 R (Assumption)
6. R (2, 3, Disjunction Elimination)

So, we have proved that (Q ∨ R) ∧ ¬Q ⊢ R using natural deduction.
